text: - Hello everyone, I'm Matt Wood,
and I'm thrilled to be here today

to announce the general
availability of Amazon Q,

the most capable generative
AI-powered assistant for work.

Q is an assistant that
helps users write code,

answer questions, summarize
data, generate content,

solve problems, manage AWS
resources and take actions.

With AWS's industry leading
enterprise security and privacy
built-in,
Amazon Q makes it easier for organizations
to use generative AI safely.

So let's break down what's
included in the launch today.
Starting with Amazon Q developer,
which is now generally available.

Trained on 17 years of AWS
knowledge and experience,
Amazon Q developer reimagines

the entire software development
lifecycle experience,
making it faster
and easier for developers
and IT pros to build, secure, manage,
and optimize applications.

Amazon Q Developer is the
most advanced coding assistant
for software developers.

Q Developer also supports
advanced features like feature
development and code transformation.

Developers can simply
describe new functionality
or a language version upgrade
and Q developer will plan, implement,
and iterate to make this possible.

Amazon Q utilizes a range
of cutting edge models,

dynamically routing tasks
to the best fit model
for superior performance.
But Amazon Q isn't just for developers,

Amazon Queue business is
generally available today too.

Q Business is a generative
AI powered assistant
that helps every employee
across the company streamline tasks
and accelerate decision making,
all from plain language inputs.

With Amazon Q Business
customers can use the data

and information that already
exists in their organization,

but held in silos to help
employees answer questions,

solve problems, generate
content, drive insights,

and take actions, allowing
them to be more productive.

Actions like piecing together
analysis, writing reports,
building presentations,
or adapting content

for different audiences are
all made quicker and easier
with Q Business.
It's quick to set up
with over 40 building connectors

for commonly used business
tools such as Wikis, Intranets,
Atlassian, Salesforce, ServiceNow, Slack,
and Amazon S3, among others.
Amazon Q Business also personalizes
interactions with each individual user

based on the customer's
existing identities, roles,
and access permissions.

It generates accurate
responses based on customer
provided information,

and customers can restrict
sensitive topics, block keywords,
and filter out inappropriate content.

We're also excited to
announce Amazon Q Apps
available today in preview.
Q Apps is a new

and powerful capability
of Amazon Q Business

that enables employees to
quickly and securely create
and share business applications
based on enterprise information.
Q apps helps you streamline
and automate your daily tasks
with no coding experience required.
Q Apps will automatically build an app

for you based on your
conversational history,
or you can simply describe the type
of app you want in natural language,
and Q will build it for you.

For example, HR professionals
can use Amazon Q apps

to build an app that
inputs an employee's name
and employee ID and uses their role
and department to create an onboarding
for their first 30 days.
In a matter of seconds,

Q Apps provides a working
app that completes the tasks.

And speaking of data,
we're taking data analytics

to the next level by integrating
Q into Amazon QuickSight,
a unified business intelligence service

that allows organizations to
deliver insights at any scale.

Q in Amazon QuickSight
reduces the time needed

to build BI dashboards
from hours to minutes.
All employees can benefit

from the generative AI
capabilities in QuickSight,

allowing them to ask
questions about dashboards,

run complex analysis
and summarize insights.
And with a simple prompt business users
can also generate data stories in minutes.

Data stories provide deep
dive narratives, key insights

and visuals and recommendations
for best actions,

which can be shared
throughout the organization.
With QuickSight new Q&A experience,
business users can ask questions
and get comprehensive answers in visual
and narrative formats
that are not covered in their dashboards

and reports, as well
as executive summaries
that provide instant insights
and highlight key trends.
Whether it's writing code,

answering questions, summarizing
data, generating content,

solving problems, managing AWS
resources or taking actions,

we're excited to see what
you can do with Amazon Q.
